question: First of all, let me ask you about your daily life. What is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
reply: This is really an everyday question..... I open the window and get some fresh air coming in.

question: Ohh, that's healthy. Do you eat a good breakfast?
reply: At the dormitory, we take turns to prepare the food and I eat well. I'm surprised that people are so careful about what they eat; breakfast needs the right balance.

question: What is your favorite food?
reply: I'm happy if there is fruit in the morning. It's been ingrained in my head by my parents that fruit in the morning is important.

question: What about your favorite dessert?
reply: I think it's macarons. I like the feel of macarons. They are expensive though, so I don't have many opportunities to buy them.

question: What is your favorite drink?
reply: I wonder...I drink a lot of citrus juice.

question: Ichinose-san, you're in your third year of high school now, so how do you spend your time at school?
reply: I don't really like studying, but I pay attention in classes properly. I often run in the morning before going to school, so sometimes I want to sleep.

question: So, do you like physical education?
reply: Yes, I like to be physically active.

question: What is your weakest subject in school?
reply: Hmm, there isn't one really. I don't want to cut down on my idol lesson time, so I try to avoid getting red marks at the very least.

question: How do you spend your time on your days off?
reply: Even during my free time, I go running and do some physical activity. I'm not very good at sitting still, I guess.

question: You're always active. What do you carry with you when you run?
reply: I have a towel and my smartphone. If I listen to music, I could run forever.

question: I could tell from just the first half of the interview that you are a very hardworking person. Do you have a place where you can relax in your busy life?
reply: In my room in the dormitory. The living room is too noisy for everyone to get together.

question: You're all under one roof, aren't you? If you had to describe your relationship with the people of Hoshimi Production in one word, how would you describe it?
reply: They're like my annoying sisters...?　It's like having a little sister constantly.

question: Are you not good at communal living?
reply: ...I was quite reluctant to do it at first, but now, well....... I'm not reluctant to do it. As expected, I'm used to it.

question: You've gotten used to it, I see. What are the dreams you want to achieve at Hoshimi Productions?
reply: My dream is to rise in the ranking of the VENUS Program and become a top idol.

question: If that dream came true, who would you want to tell first?
reply: My brother and... my parents.

question: Now, let me ask you about idols. Why did you become an idol?
reply: I was looking for my next goal after winning a dance competition, when I happened to meet someone from the agency. I realized that there was this new path. I think it's a new challenge for me, and I want to be at the top if I have to do it.

question: Yes, you've danced before, right? So you like dancing more than singing?
reply: I've been dancing since I was in elementary school. That's all I've known.

question: With the phrase "I'm not going to lose to anyone!", would you say your good points as an idol include dancing?
reply: Yes, but when I joined this industry, I realized that there are always better performers. The current professionals, including me, are not able to compete with our rivals unless they practice more. I have a sense of urgency that I, as an experienced dancer, will have to lead the way.

question: I see, the idol industry is a tough place. You are very observant. Do you have any rivals?
reply: When I joined the industry, I was immediately impressed with LizNoir. I wondered how they could all dance like that....

question: You never know if you'll ever be on the same stage as them, do you? So what do you think you'd be doing if you hadn't become an idol?
reply: I think I'd still be dancing. I might have wanted to be a dance coach or a performer.

question: What is the most important thing in your idol career?
reply: When you start... don't stop. You have to put your all into it, without cutting corners so that people can always see your best performance.

question: I can feel your strong will. What's the most important thing you've ever done?
reply: Up until now, I've been trying to win a dance competition. Now I'm trying my best to be the best as an idol.

question: What has been the most frustrating moment for you?
reply: The moment when I achieve the best possible result, but the person I want to be recognized by does not acknowledge me.

question: What was the happiest moment for you?
reply: Happiest...? I guess it was the debut live performance. The reaction of the audience was great, and it was definitely rewarding. That feeling is addictive.

question: What kind of place is a live show for you?
reply: It's a place where you can express yourself and improve yourself with the other members.

question: How did you feel when you first got on stage?
reply: It was a strange sensation, different from a dance competition. I thought I wasn't nervous until just before the performance, but I felt a little bit down on my feet... I mean, I'm a professional, but I'm not quite there yet.

question: No, I think that's true for everyone at first. Has there been a moment in your career so far where you felt a bond with someone?
reply: When I'm not feeling well, I feel a bond with the members when they talk to me, even if they think they are hiding it. I also notice it when I see them. You can tell when you're living together.

question: So is there someone you consider to be your best friend within the members?
reply: It's not that we don't get along, but it's hard to say we're best friends..... we're all rivals rather than best friends. I wonder who it would be...?

question: Don't think so hard!　So, can you recommend the best spot in Hoshimi City?
reply: Super Takemiya (Takemiya Supermarket) has a great selection of cheap and fresh produce. Try the fresh fish delivered directly from Hoshimi fishing port. If you want to shop, go to Super Takemiya.

question: It sounds like an advertisement (laughs), but I can feel your love for the area. Ichinose-san, you are from Hoshimi City, right?
reply: Yes, I've always been in Hoshimi City, but I used to go to Tokyo a lot for dance lessons.

question: Did you always want to be a dancer from your childhood?
reply: That's right. When I was little, I was very much into dance when I was interested in it.

question: How did you become interested in it?
reply: When I saw the cast members dancing at the theme park I went to with my parents, I made up my mind to do it too.

question: It was such a shock to me that you made up your mind to do it at such a young age. You said you're good at dancing, but do you like music?
reply: My brother was always a big music lover, so I'm influenced by him, so I don't care what genre I'm listening to.

question: I see. Now, let's ask you about your music. What was your first impression of "Shine Purity" when you first heard it?
reply: The song was cooler than I had imagined for an idol song. To be honest, I was surprised. But at the same time, I wasn't sure if I'd be able to sing it.

question: If you had to explain "Shine Purity" in one word, how would you describe it?
reply: Probably... it's a song made by us; it's not perfect, but it's still good....

question: "It's not perfect, but it's good"... I see. What's your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
reply: "I'm here with you, and I'm gonna shine, I'm not alone anymore" It makes me feel closer to the members than before, and I feel like it resonates with me somehow... eh... please don't nod so much, I'm embarrassed.

question: No, I just find it interesting. Now, it's time for the end. Have you had any troubles lately?
reply: As I said before, I think about how we can catch up with our rivals every day. But there's nothing we can do.

question: That's the problem with being an idol, isn't it? So what are you looking forward to the most right now?
reply: I look forward to each day, but it's so much fun to make new songs and to learn new dance choreography.

question: What's the best gift you've ever received?
reply: That story I just told you about the theme park was actually a birthday present from my parents. I was a only little but I was very happy. I haven't received anything recently though.

question: So, let's go even deeper. Ichinose-san, what is your ideal idol?
reply: An idol who can overwhelm the audience with her best performance.

question: What would you like to say to yourself in 10 years' time?
reply: A message? "Please keep up the good work in the future". I'm sorry, I can't say anything witty... I'm not good at this kind of thing.

question: That's okay. You did fine. What do you think of your fans?
reply: I can get energy and courage from them. I didn't feel it so much when I was dancing, but I realized that cheering gives me strength.

question: This is my final question; what does being an idol mean to you?
reply: I think that just like the dancers I saw, idols are capable of delivering dreams and smiles... especially these days.

question: So, finally, a few words for your fans.
reply: Your support is what motivates us. I hope you'll look forward to seeing us as we continue to grow. I hope you keep supporting us.
